p: Finally, we measured what the impact of this selfless behaviour among the poorest participants on the global inequality was. Gini Coeficcient, apart from a standard way to calculate inequality levels in economics, is completely appropriate here since general behaviour consisting on contributing the fair share would leave the value of Gini Coefficient constant ( S13 Fig). Thus, in the equal treatment the Gini Coefficient increases from 0 (initial distribution) to 0.1806 at the end of the experiment, whereas in the unequal treatment increases from 0.1812 to 0.3483.
